text: Planomicrobium glaciei is a species of bacteria. De-Chao Zhang, Hong-Can Liu, Yu-Hua Xin, Yong Yu, Pei-Jin Zhou und Yu-Guang Zhou: Planomicrobium glaciei sp. nov., a psychrotolerant bacterium isolated from a glacier In: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology 2009, Band 59, Nr.6, S. 1387â€“1390 The cells are first coccoid. After some time they change to rods. The bacterium use the aerobic respiration with oxygen. The bacterium does not form endospores. It belongs to the gram-positive Firmicutes. == References == Category:Gram-positive bacteria
title: Planomicrobium glaciei
